summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to AT&T, commanding the production of records related to specific telephone numbers for an investigation into alleged violations of sex trafficking and related statutes. It is accompanied by a certification of authenticity from an AT&T Legal Compliance Analyst.

persons.name: Christine Carson
persons.context: She attests to the authenticity of AT&T records being provided in response to the grand jury subpoena, certifying under penalty of perjury that they are true duplicates made in the ordinary course of business.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He signed and issued the grand jury subpoena to AT&T on June 15, 2020, as part of an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking laws.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for AT&T
events.description: The subpoena commands AT&T to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Manhattan to testify and produce records, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced electronically by the return date.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to AT&T
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY issues a subpoena to AT&T for all records related to specific telephone numbers, covering the period from March 1, 2020, to the present, as part of an investigation into alleged sex trafficking violations.

events.title: Certification of Authenticity Signed
events.description: Christine Carson of AT&T signs a certificate attesting to the authenticity of the records being produced in response to the subpoena, under penalty of perjury.

locations: 11760 US Highway 1, Suite 300, North Palm Beach, FL 33408 (AT&T Wireless Legal Compliance address)
40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY (United States Courthouse for SDNY Grand Jury)
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an active federal grand jury investigation in the Southern District of New York into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2423(a), and 2422(b) (related to coercion/enticement and travel for illegal sexual activity).

AT&T is commanded to produce extensive records for specific telephone numbers, including call details, subscriber information, billing, text messages, IP history, and associated email addresses, for the period from March 1, 2020, to the present.
The subpoena includes a strict non-disclosure request, prohibiting AT&T from informing any third party about the subpoena due to the ongoing nature of the investigation.
The document demonstrates the use of formal legal procedures (Federal Rules of Evidence 902(11) and 902(13)) to authenticate business records for use in a federal criminal investigation.
The investigation appears to be active as of June 2020, focusing on communications data that could be critical for establishing patterns of contact or coordination related to the alleged offenses.
